intro: Trigonostemon voratus, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
